nodes.bodyText: What's the implication of not adding failing views to the view map? What would happen if one of these views was referenced in a query?
view resolution shouldn't be impacted, as getViews method is only used for listing views and columns.

Based on your comment, are you leaning toward not committing this test because you're worried about future versions of Coral supporting these functions? Perhaps you can instead use a construct that you think may never be supported by Coral? I like the idea of keeping the test if it's possible. FWIW, there are often times that tests need to be removed as functionality evolves.
Added a more reliable test.

Can we have a test for reading information_schema.views when one of the views cannot be translated?
(in fact, we could perhaps define a totally bogus view for that -- would that be possible?)
Also, can we have a test for reading information_schema.columns without and with filter?
This is where the ConnectorMetadata.getViews seems to be also used.
Added the suggested tests.

Can you also add a test to TestHiveViewsLegacy.java to document behavior difference.
...
Second thought, actually it may not apply, as I am not sure if you may force legacy view translation logic to throw HIVE_VIEW_TRANSLATION_ERROR

DISTINCT table_name -> table_name, column_name
so that we test also what is returned for these views
Why does it fail? In the unfiltered information_schema.columns query we were OK to use information available in metastore, without translating the view. Why are we not doing this here?
This is because the unfiltered version uses HiveMetadata#getViews, which ignores failures. Filtered version uses HiveMetadata#getView which doesn't.
That's technically understood and what i anticipated, but is there a sound reason for the difference?

Note that information_schema.views also has a similar discrepancy of ignoring v/s failing for unfiltered v/s filtered case. Do you think the discrepancy is okay there but not for information_schema.columns?
An argument in favor of the discrepancy is that - we want to show most other metadata (from valid views) when only some of the tables/views have invalid metadata. In the "filtered" case, the specific view being looked for is problematic, so failing doesn't result in losing any metadata.
To make filtered v/s unfiltered cases more consistent, I think it'd help to make ConnectorMetadata#getViews (and other listing calls) return an iterator, but may be do such an SPI change in a separate PR.

From SQL perspective, I see how this is problematic. While listing with a coerce filter, we ignore the failing view. But for point-lookup, we fail the query. So to be consistent, we might want to always ignore so that we can atleast return partial correct metadata where we can. How about we swallow PrestoExceptions from https://github.com/trinodb/trino/blob/master/core/trino-main/src/main/java/io/trino/metadata/MetadataManager.java#L1036 to do this? This will resolve discrepancy for both the tables.

I think you made a valid point and i see how inconsistent it is. It is not limited to views either and we have this "ignore or throw? sacrifice SQL consistency?" challenge in other places as well.
I think it does not help to solve those cases on one-by-one basis, as this may lead to different decisions in different cases (eg due to different priorities or whatever else).
Let's maybe have a dedicated discussion, document the outcome somewhere and go ahead.
My prediction is that chances are high we come to the conclusion aligned with your thinking, but i would really want to preserve the consistency by being a bit more structured about the decision making process.
What do you think?

@findepi Does it seem reasonable to you to go ahead with this PR in the current form? We can update this test for filtered case in future according to the final verdict in #6551. (The current approach seems aligned with @kokosing 's opinion too.)
We should also ignore TableNotFoundException (race condition)
Make sure it's clear we're talking about Trino's information_schema, not the one in HMS
Please move the comment just above assertion queries.

I very much dislike annotation-based requirements, because they make working with tests harder.
Anyway TestHiveViewsLegacy already uses this, so please keep it.
import the inner classes
assertThatThrownBy should be followed with the actual assertion.

Can't you assert on rows() using standard collection assertion:
Assertions.assertThat(query(withNoFilter).rows()).doesNotContain(.....)
Why this does not depend on the hive version? please add a comment

Let's use "Trino" here even though the body has onPresto.
Less work later.
